text: Thomas Walter Bickett was an American Democratic Party politician who served as governor of North Carolina from 1917 to 1921. Bickett's tenure was notable for the passage of a wide range of progressive social reforms.Public letters and papers of Thomas Walter Bickett: Governor of North Carolina, 1917-1921, P.279-286 Negatively, however, his tenure also saw the passage of a law, as one study described it, "to prevent incurable mental defectives from perpetuating their species."Public letters and papers of Thomas Walter Bickett: Governor of North Carolina, 1917-1921, P.285 ==References== Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Governors of North Carolina Category:North Carolina attorneys general
title: Thomas Walter Bickett
